title: How to join the Chelsea Football Club Academy when I am far from England - Quora

response.answer_text: The most effective way of getting scouted for a trial at Chelsea FC Academy is to join a Chelsea Soccer School. Scouts regularly select young players from soccer school sessions and invite them to trial at the development centers for Chelsea FC, and anyone can play in their soccer schools so it offers an open door for all to get spotted. To get scouted for a trial at Chelsea FC Academy simply collect the following information: Players CVCovering LetterPlayers Vital Statistics: Players position, Age, Date of Birth, Height, Weight, contact email/phone/address, current club, previous clubs, detail of any trials already attended, any representative honors such as school, districts, county etcPlayers school they attendFixture list of your current team, including location and kick off time to be passed to scoutOnce you have collated all of the above information, send it Chelsea FC Academy via this address:Chelsea Football Club Academy, Cobham Training Ground, 64 Stoke Road, Stoke D’Abernon, Cobham, Surrey, KT11 3PT Chelsea Academy will assess your application and decide whether or not to send a scout to watch the game. The admissions test takes less than an hour. It’s a long shot . . . a very long shot. You’d have to be at the top echelon of players in your home country, and THEN manage to get noticed by someone from Chelsea and THEN play a position where the youth managers believe they are lacking. Seeing as CFC’s youth side recently won the youth FA Cup they aren’t hurting for talent. If you’re in Europe, your chances increase. The further you are away the less likely it is. If you ever manage to become one of the best players where you live and become a professional you’d have a better chance of someday joining CFC. Their scouts are always looking for talent to buy and rely on foreign players moreso than talent from their academy if you’ve noticed.
